bug.author: josh
bug.summary: Internal prediction _debug outputs triggering conversion crash
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
I ran into this issue trying to using a KNearestNeighborsClassifierBuilder layer and running predict on the model. I did some debugging and it appears to be related to some internal _debugNearestDistances outputs being returned by the model. I'm not sure if these are temporary to the beta or what their long term intent is. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Here's a minimal example that reproduces the issue. from coremltools.models import MLModel from coremltools.models.nearest_neighbors import KNearestNeighborsClassifierBuilder import numpy as np
builder = KNearestNeighborsClassifierBuilder( input_name="input", output_name="label", number_of_dimensions=1, default_class_label="???", )
model = MLModel(builder.spec) data = {"input": np.array([1.0])}
# Error: Unrecognized sequence type. model.predict(data) The error is thrown from Utils::convertSequenceValueToPython:
coremltools/coremlpython/CoreMLPythonUtils.mm
Line 561 in 08dc420
throw std::runtime_error("Error: Unrecognized sequence type.");
I originally thought it was an issue with my input data, but it's actually crashing trying to convert the output to a Python object. Inside the return output is a field called _debugNearestDistances that is a MLSequence of MLFeatureTypeDouble. The MLFeatureTypeDouble type is also odd since that doesn't seem to be a legal type of sequence, but I'm not sure about that. I guess I'm not sure if the issue is more to do with the framework level CoreML APIs or if it's something coremltools should handle or maybe just discard any _ fields. Thanks! <denchmark-h:h2>System environment</denchmark-h>
coremltools 4.0b3 (and master) OS macOS 11.0 Beta 20A5354i Xcode 12.0 beta 6 (12A8189n) Python 3.8.5
